ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They see it as something distant,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They surely take it to be far away,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They think that it (the Day of Judgment) is far away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They deem it to be remote.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, they see it (the torment) afar off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely they think it to be far off,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: behold, they see it as if far off;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! they behold it afar off
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They see it [the Day of Judgement] to be far off,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily they behold it afar off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed they see it to be far off,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! They see it (the torment) afar off,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: they see it as being far off;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:6] Lo! they see it, that is, the chastisement, as [being] far off, as never taking place;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! They) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca (behold it) i.e. the doom on the Day of Judgement (afar off) it will not happen
